questions.question: Which UML diagram shows structural relationships between classes?
What multiplicity exists between Student and Course classes?
Which relationship implies whole/part objects are created and die together?
Which pair demonstrates generalization/specialization?
What models attributes of a relationship between classes?
Which relationship allows parts to exist independently of the whole?
What multiplicity indicates 'one or more'?
Which diagram defines the boundary between system and environment?
Which classes typically store persistent data?
Which element is added to classes during design modeling?
Which multiplicity means 'optional (zero or one)'?
In banking systems, which class would track available denominations?
What relationship does generalization represent?
What specifies how many instances of one class relate to another?
What does composition hierarchy represent?
What appears outside the system boundary in context diagrams?
Which would be a subclass in banking systems?
How would you model 'a car has 2 or 4 doors' in multiplicity?
In an Employee-Project association class, what attribute would likely appear?
What is the whole called in composition relationships?
What do rectangles in class diagrams contain?
Which example shows a one-to-many relationship?
What do entity classes primarily handle?
What does conceptual static modeling emphasize?
An association class can model attributes of a many-to-many relationship.
Generalization hierarchy shows 'has-a' relationships between classes.
A class can have multiple associations with other classes.
Composition implies weaker binding than aggregation.
Entity classes are often mapped to database tables during implementation.
All class attributes must be public in static modeling.
A subclass can add new attributes not present in its superclass.
Association classes are used for one-to-one relationships only.
The system context diagram shows interactions with external entities.
Multiplicity constraints only apply to aggregation relationships.
A car having exactly 4 wheels would use numeric multiplicity '4'.
Static modeling during analysis focuses on implementation details.
A bank account system would model Account as an entity class.
Operations are typically defined during analysis modeling.
An ATM class would have composition relationships with its hardware components.
External classes appear inside the system boundary in context diagrams.
